title: I have no faith in the automated system anymore.
body:
As the title says, I have no faith in the automated system anymore. Not only have 0% of the people I've seen be _hypertoxic_ in game get banned, I've also had occasional games myself where I've flipped shit and threw around some not so lovely words, and I haven't been chat restricted either.

So i see people on here complaining about permabans, and I'm just like what did you possibly do to get permabanned???

replies.body:
It's less about extreme toxic behavior, but *consistent* toxic behavior of any nature. Getting "hypertoxic" in 10 of 1000 games is less likely to get you banned than being mildly toxic in 10 of 10 games.

Since the system now works on a 4-step escalating punishment system (no more infinitely stacking chat restrictions) it doesn't matter how severe the crime is, if you are repeatedly punished in a short amount of time it will lead to a permaban.
